The orientation of the polycarbonate membranes is not important.

Reduce risk of them flying after vacuum is removed.
Close the plasma cleaner door, and then

Allow vacuum to form for 2 minutes.
Once the vacuum has formed, simultaneously
Turn the valve to 12:00 while turning the power to the Hi setting \(shown below).

Increase or decrease the amount of oxygen you are letting into the chamber.
Treat membranes with plasma for 7 minutes.

Turn the RF level valve from HIGH to OFF, then
Then slowly open the valve until you can barely hear air entering chamber \(Approximate valve

Dry membrane, preventing the membrane from folding on itself.

Drop so that it adheres to the slide before dispensing the entire volume.
Move any air bubbles underneath the membrane using wafer forceps.
Membranes are now functionalized and ready for use.
**Note 1:** Membranes solvated with 1xPBS should be used within 48 hours.
Move all but ~1 mL of PBS to prevent membranes from flipping within the dish.
Alternatively, membranes can be solvated in 1xPBS, dried out, and stored for 4 weeks at room temperature.
When ready to use membranes, they can be rehydrated with 1xPBS.
This is helpful when traveling with membranes or when you want to
Run Seq-Well in a laboratory without access to a plasma cleaner.

The time necessary for detachment of the top slide varies \(10 seconds – 5 minutes).
Once the top slide has detached,
Add 5 mL of complete lysis buffer to each array.
Alternatively, 5 mL of complete lysis buffer can be prepared by adding 25 uL of 20% Sarkosyl and 50 uL of Beta-mercaptoethanol to pre-lysis buffer.
Separate waste container for lysis buffer because guanidine thiocyanate can react with bleach in TC traps to create toxic gas.

_Purification of the Tagmented Library and Analysis on the BioAnalyzer_
Purify tagmentation products using Ampure SPRI beads at 0.6x volumetric ratio.
Run a BioAnalyzer High Sensitivity Chip according to the manufacturer’s instructions.
Use 1 ul of the purified cDNA sample as input.
Your tagmented library should be fairly smooth, with an average bp size of 650-750bp.
Smaller-sized libraries will have more polyA reads; larger libraries may have lower
Sequence cluster density and cluster quality.
We have successfully sequenced libraries from 420-800 bps.

For a detailed loading protocol, please consult the Illumina website for a step-by-step manual.
